metadata.title: CVE-2022-25309 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the Fribidi package andaffects the fribidi_cap_rtl_to_unicode() function of thefribidi-char-sets-cap-rtl.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to pass aspecially crafted file to the Fribidi application with the '--caprtl'option, leading to a crash and causing a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfribidi-bin - 1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1
libfribidi0 - 1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fribidi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1').
